intro: Psychotria cuspidella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and quinine. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish-white flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when mature. Psychotria cuspidella is often found in shaded, humid environments within rainforests.
